alert.note: Alert for Brantley; Clinch; Northeastern Charlton; Northern Ware; Southern Ware; Western Charlton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 30 at 7:17PM EST by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Brantley, central Ware, northeastern Clinch and northern Charlton Counties through 800 PM EST... At 717 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout 9 miles southeast of Argyle, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts and wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Folkston, Nahunta, Homeland, Hickox, Braganza, Race Pond, Fort Mudge and Winokur. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Brantley; Clinch; Northeastern Charlton; Northern Ware; Southern Ware; Western Charlton
